revised_title: Localization and Induction in Early Development of Xenopus
tldr: The article discusses the localization and induction processes in early development of Xenopus. The authors suggest that the sperm aster determines the direction of rotation of the cortex, which activates latent dorsalizing-axializing agents in the vegetal hemisphere. This process plays a crucial role in determining the regional differences in the embryo, including the position of the blastopore and the formation of ectodermal and endodermal structures.
